body:
Sounds like MEGA have changed the login protocol. This is implemented by this go library https://github.com/t3rm1n4l/go-mega - however it was reverse engineered from C++ code as there are no docs for the MEGA API.

You could try the megacmd running a webdav server and connect rclone to that.

If you like MEGA and just want storage you could try [MEGA S4](https://mega.io/objectstorage) which is fully supported by rclone.
Yeah, I'm considering using mega s4, I don't want to lose additional e2e encryption layer though. Thank you for looking into this issue!

> If you like MEGA and just want storage you could try [MEGA S4](https://mega.io/objectstorage) which is fully supported by rclone.

no I use the free version of MEGA

issue.title: Login fails. See the inpact in rclone

repository.name: go-mega
repository.description: A client library in go for mega.co.nz storage service

issue.body:
https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/8758

Seems that mega changed login API and it is not working anymore unless this library is updated

Critical impact.

body:
> Sounds like MEGA have changed the login protocol. This is implemented by this go library https://github.com/t3rm1n4l/go-mega - however it was reverse engineered from C++ code as there are no docs for the MEGA API.
> 
> You could try the megacmd running a webdav server and connect rclone to that.
> 
> If you like MEGA and just want storage you could try [MEGA S4](https://mega.io/objectstorage) which is fully supported by rclone.

Opened an issue in the go library github repository. Although it seems you @ncw are the one keeping that library alive ...

> Sounds like MEGA have changed the login protocol. This is implemented by this go library https://github.com/t3rm1n4l/go-mega - however it was reverse engineered from C++ code as there are no docs for the MEGA API.
> 
> You could try the megacmd running a webdav server and connect rclone to that.
> 
> If you like MEGA and just want storage you could try [MEGA S4](https://mega.io/objectstorage) which is fully supported by rclone.

@ncw 
Once again thank for rclone.

I suppose github is not offering other better tag to apply than bug, as I would refuse to call it a bug ... it is an issue, an impact on the code, due to a third party change in their API, not a programming error at all...

In any case, this is killing direct access to mega for rclone. As I said, not due to a rclone fault!

Looks like that the issue can only be solved by the team of the used library.

I know one cannot expect and should not ask for response times around FOSS. It would even not be polite. And moreover when the solution is depending on another party ...

My personal view, without any more insight, is that this might need long time for solution, if any... As such, this would imply that I (and anyone in the need) would be needing to find another solution for mega access.

Could you share your view about a timeframe to expect a solution for the issue? (no commitment asked, only for your impression, no one to blame if prediction fails ...). Taking into account your knowledge/patching to the library, might be you can have an authoritative answer...

Best,
CT

NB:
Not trying at all to publicize any competing code, but anyone in the need, besides using browser access, I would try https://xff.cz/megatools/ and not MEGA proprietary headless code. MEGA being more oriented to sync, megatools is closer in use to rclone, and it is also open and free code. On the playing field since 2013.
According megatools site, it caters with the 402 issue. (Changelog - megatools 1.11.5 - 2025-07-06 - This release implements mega.nz X-Hashcash to handle 402 status responses as suggested by a user. This should handle 402 errors returned by mega.nz.)
Not that I recommend to ditch rclone at all!
Not that I intend to press the rclone team at all!
I used megatools in the past; pretty secure and robust; switched to rclone for many features one essential its ability to handle in a unified way many remotes. On the other hand, megatools (independent, free, open source, not based in libraries) is a solution focused in mega. No, I have no links to the developer, and yes, I am an ex-happy user.
Your mileage might vary.

This is the commit from metatools implementing hashcash

https://xff.cz/git/megatools/commit/?id=1fd7042da36387448e7b51deecdec76dd2565387

There is a hashcash package for go also which looks very outdated but might have some ideas in

https://github.com/umahmood/hashcash

What this needs is a volunteer to integrate hashcash into go-mega.

I don't know why, but my account is still working without ever giving 402 errors

> I don't know why, but my account is still working without ever giving 402 errors

At some point after creating this issue, my paid account started working with rclone as well, though certainly not within the 24h timeframe suggested by support. I also have a couple of free accounts that never had this issue.
Also note to anyone who considers using mega s4 as a workaround: you can't get used/free space info through `rclone about` via s3 endpoint. This has caused some of my automations to break.

Here are similar issues in other projects:

- https://github.com/gpailler/MegaApiClient/issues/248
- https://github.com/PhilippC/keepass2android/issues/2922
- https://github.com/duplicati/duplicati/issues/5048

Recently my account was blocked, after which I started getting 402 error. I
changed the password, but forgot to change it in `rclone` - the 402 code kept
appearing. After I changed the password via `rclone config`, mounting via `rclone`
worked again. But it is not clear whether this will work permanently or only for
24 hours, as it is stated here:

- https://github.com/duplicati/duplicati/issues/5048#issuecomment-3146438803

Tests from https://github.com/t3rm1n4l/go-mega also work with the new password,
so it is not clear how to test the functionality of the 402 handler in future.

The old password still causes 402 error code. **Make sure you have access to your recovery email before trying this!**

There are more implementations:

- https://pkg.go.dev/search?q=hashcash&m=

This looks more up to date:

- https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/catalinc/hashcash

And this have parallelism:

- https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/repbin/repbin/hashcash

@ncw, any reason to use https://github.com/umahmood/hashcash ?

> What this needs is a volunteer to integrate hashcash into go-mega.

Would love but would need to start learning go and how to use github ... not see it easy for me thought ...

At least there is information about the change, not having to (directly) reverse engineer the mega API.
Lets hope we got a champion for the change.
TIA
CT

We now have a fix for this - testers much appreciated :-)

[v1.72.0-beta.9125.9b99f6e80.fix-8758-mega-hashcache](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-8758-mega-hashcache/v1.72.0-beta.9125.9b99f6e80.fix-8758-mega-hashcache/) on branch [fix-8758-mega-hashcache](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-8758-mega-hashcache) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.72 or v1.71.2 if we make that
